publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1971 Trish Godman: Overcrowding on Scottish Train Services—That the Parliament is seriously concerned at the abject failure of ScotRail officials to address the serious problem of gross overcrowding of trains in Scotland and, especially, on the commuter train running from Glasgow to Edinburgh; believes that this cramming of passengers into trains is, at worst, a potential safety hazard of some magnitude and, at best, a source of serious discomfort and stress, especially to elderly and disabled passengers and that it acts as a powerful deterrent to those who would travel on public transport if they could be guaranteed a level of comfort that equals the standards to be found in most European Union member states and Scandinavian countries, and calls on the Scottish Executive to engage in discussions with senior officials of ScotRail in order to enhance the safety and comfort of rail passengers in Scotland.
S2M-1971 Overcrowding on Scottish Train Services (lodged on 8 November 2004) Ms Sandra White*

S2M-1971 Overcrowding on Scottish Train Services (lodged on 8 November 2004) Christine May*, Mark Ballard*, Chris Ballance*, Eleanor Scott*, Colin Fox*, Patrick Harvie*, Ms Wendy Alexander*, Robert Brown*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Mr Andrew Welsh*, Marlyn Glen*, Shiona Baird*, Des McNulty*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*
S2M-1971 Overcrowding on Scottish Train Services (lodged on 8 November 2004) Mrs Mary Mulligan*

S2M-1971 Trish Godman: Overcrowding on Scottish Train Services—That the Parliament is seriously concerned at the abject failure of ScotRail officials to address the serious problem of gross overcrowding of trains in Scotland and, especially, on the commuter train running from Glasgow to Edinburgh; believes that this cramming of passengers into trains is, at worst, a potential safety hazard of some magnitude and, at best, a source of serious discomfort and stress, especially to elderly and disabled passengers and that it acts as a powerful deterrent to those who would travel on public transport if they could be guaranteed a level of comfort that equals the standards to be found in most European Union member states and Scandinavian countries, and calls on the Scottish Executive to engage in discussions with senior officials of ScotRail in order to enhance the safety and comfort of rail passengers in Scotland. Supported by: Ms Sandra White, Christine May, Mark Ballard, Chris Ballance, Eleanor Scott, Colin Fox, Patrick Harvie, Ms Wendy Alexander, Robert Brown, Mr Frank McAveety, Mr Andrew Welsh, Marlyn Glen, Shiona Baird, Des McNulty, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Mrs Mary Mulligan, John Swinburne*
S2M-1971 Overcrowding on Scottish Train Services (lodged on 8 November 2004) Mr Mark Ruskell*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*
S2M-1971 Overcrowding on Scottish Train Services (lodged on 8 November 2004) Mr Adam Ingram*, Irene Oldfather*, Rosie Kane*
S2M-1971 Overcrowding on Scottish Train Services (lodged on 8 November 2004) Maureen Macmillan*, Donald Gorrie*
S2M-1971 Overcrowding on Scottish Train Services (lodged on 8 November 2004) Nora Radcliffe*
S2M-1971 Overcrowding on Scottish Train Services (lodged on 8 November 2004) Sarah Boyack*
S2M-1971 Overcrowding on Scottish Train Services (lodged on 8 November 2004) Pauline McNeill*
S2M-1971 Overcrowding on Scottish Train Services (lodged on 8 November 2004) Susan Deacon*
S2M-1971 Overcrowding on Scottish Train Services (lodged on 8 November 2004) Cathy Peattie*
S2M-1971 Overcrowding on Scottish Train Services (lodged on 8 November 2004) Frances Curran*
